docs.snippet: Michael Punke is the United States ambassador to the World Trade Organization, a role that is seriously limiting his celebrity....
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Punke is the United States ambassador to the World Trade Organization, a role that is seriously limiting his celebrity.
docs.abstract: Profile of Michael Punke, deputy United States Trade Representative and US ambassador to World Trade Organization whose 2002 novel The Revenant served as inspiration for Alejandro G Inarritu's eponymous film; Punke is excited about fact film has been nominated for 12 Oscars, including best picture, but is unable to take spotlight for his role due to federal ethics rules given his government position.

headline.main: ‘The Revenant’ Author Michael Punke Has a Day Job
headline.print_headline: He Wrote a Novel Called ‘The Revenant.’ He Can’t Talk About It.
